text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- King Hassan releases from government the ministers belonging to the parliamentary majority so they can focus entirely on political activities during campaigning for legislative elections. Special session of parliament called for August 17. Elections due to be held later this year.

- Number of tourists arriving in Morocco in June rose 22.4 percent compared to the same month last year, says tourism minister. The only black mark was the continuing drop in number of British tourists which fell 8.9 percent in the month compared to June 1996.
- Moroccan city of Casablanca is 81st on a list of 145 of the world's most expensive cities, according to a Geneva-based private consultancy.
- Schooling in Morocco's rural regions is a challenge facing the public authorities.
- King Hassan thanks government ministers with party ties, says they should focus their activities on next legislative elections.
- Ambassadors of Oman, Indonesia, Yemen and Egypt decorated by king at end of their missions.
- Households need to prepare for increased water charges.
